duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform scheduled and unscheduled aircraft maintenance, including repairs and modifications to aircraft structures, components, and engines.
Troubleshoot and diagnose complex aircraft mechanical components and electrical systems, making repairs and replacements when necessary.
Maintain aircraft components, including flight controls, engines, hydraulics, pneumatics, fuel systems, and mechanical components.
Perform inspections, operational checks, and maintenance actions in aircraft records/forms.
Operate ground support equipment, hand tools, and special tools applicable to aircraft maintenance.
Accomplish preflight, thru-flight, basic post-flight, and phase inspections, as well as launch and recover aircraft as required.
Maintain aircraft appearance and cleanliness, and work in compliance with safety requirements, including portable firefighting equipment operation.

education_certification.credential: Valid up-to-date A&P license and Five (5) years aviation maintenance experience, including five (5) years rotary wing aircraft experience, and two (2) years on the assigned MDS LUH-72. Bachelor's degree in Aviation Maintenance or related field required.
